channel.title: This American Life
channel.description: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Another 2.5 million people download the weekly podcast. It is hosted by Ira Glass, produced in collaboration with Chicago Public Media, delivered to stations by PRX The Public Radio Exchange, and has won all of the major broadcasting awards.
channel.itunes:author: This American Life
channel.itunes:subtitle: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Another 2.5 million people download the weekly podcast.

item.title: 783: Kids These Days
item.description: We hear from kids who are dealing with some of the country’s most contentious debates. Debates that are supposedly about them.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: We hear from kids who are dealing with some of the country’s most contentious debates. Debates that are supposedly about them.
item.itunes:summary: We hear from kids who are dealing with some of the country’s most contentious debates. Debates that are supposedly about them.

item.title: 754: Spark Bird
item.description: Stories about birds and the hearts they sway, the havoc they wreak, the lives they change.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Birds—the hearts they sway, the havoc they wreck, the lives they change.
item.itunes:summary: Stories about birds and the hearts they sway, the havoc they wreak, the lives they change.

item.title: 782: Family Dig
item.description: Two people go on excavations of their families’ pasts. Including the first episode of the new podcast, “We Were Three,” hosted by our longtime producer, Nancy Updike, and from Serial Productions and The New York Times.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Two people go on excavations of their families’ pasts.
item.itunes:summary: Two people go on excavations of their families’ pasts. Including the first episode of the new podcast, “We Were Three,” hosted by our longtime producer, Nancy Updike, and from Serial Productions and The New York Times.

item.title: 781: Watching the Watchers
item.description: People taking it upon themselves to keep an eye on those in charge.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: People taking it upon themselves to keep an eye on those in charge.
item.itunes:summary: People taking it upon themselves to keep an eye on those in charge.

item.title: 780: Setting the Record Straight
item.description: Getting to the facts can be difficult, but it’s always the right thing to do. Except when it isn’t.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Getting to the facts can be difficult, but it’s always the right thing to do. Except when it isn’t.
item.itunes:summary: Getting to the facts can be difficult, but it’s always the right thing to do. Except when it isn’t.

item.title: 779: Ends of the Earth
item.description: An exploration of the very upper limits of what you do for someone you love.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: An exploration of the very upper limits of what you do for someone you love.
item.itunes:summary: An exploration of the very upper limits of what you do for someone you love.

item.title: 778: Me Minus Me
item.description: When a fundamental part of yourself changes dramatically, are you still who you thought you were?
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: When a fundamental part of yourself changes dramatically, are you still who you thought you were?
item.itunes:summary: When a fundamental part of yourself changes dramatically, are you still who you thought you were?

item.title: 777: Name. Age. Detail.
item.description: Ten people were killed at a grocery store in Buffalo, NY. Their stories, as you’ve never heard them.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Ten people were killed at a grocery store in Buffalo, NY. Their stories, as you’ve never heard them.
item.itunes:summary: Ten people were killed at a grocery store in Buffalo, NY. Their stories, as you’ve never heard them.

item.title: 776: I Work Better on Deadline
item.description: Stories of people racing against time to solve a problem. Will they make it?
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories of people racing against time to solve a problem. Will they make it?
item.itunes:summary: Stories of people racing against time to solve a problem. Will they make it?

item.title: 775: The Possum Experiment
item.description: An investigation into a very basic question about people: Are most of us bad or good?
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: An investigation into a very basic question about people: Are most of us bad or good?
item.itunes:summary: An investigation into a very basic question about people: Are most of us bad or good?
